section.title: Compilation From Source
section.para: If you want to compile Aten by hand (e.g. if you're keeping your own copy of the source and updating it via subversion) then these guides may help.

section.title: Linux
section.para: Very few Linux distributions have guides in this section - if you wish to contribute details of your own experience for the benefit of others, get in touch.

section.title: Installing Subversion and obtaining the source
section.para: Run the following commands to install subversion (if you don't already have it) and download the latest source to a directory names 'aten-latest' in the current directory:
section.synopsis: bob@pc:~> sudo apt-get install subversion bob@pc:~> svn co http://aten.googlecode.com/svn/trunk ./aten-latest bob@pc:~> cd aten-latest

section.title: Installing all necessary pre-requisites
section.para: The following command should install all necessary packages needed to compile Aten, including the Qt4 development libraries, C++ (g++) compiler, and the automake/libtool packages.
section.synopsis: bob@pc:> sudo apt-get install autotools-dev libtool autoconf automake g++ libreadline5-dev libqt4-gui libqt4-opengl libqt4-core libqt4-dev

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para: GNU Autotools >=2.6 or CMake >=2.4.8 - the choice is yours, really. CMake tends to be easier because it handles all the Qt-related elements explicitly, but a pretty recent version is required. Follow the relevant sections below.

Qt4 >=4.2 - again, two choices. Trolltech offer an installable disk image, providing Qt4 as a proper Framework (see http://trolltech.com/products/appdev/platform/qt-for-mac ). Alternatively, Qt4 is available on Fink (qt4-x11).
OpenGL - This __should__ be installed as standard.
pkg-config - If you're using the Fink installation of Qt4, then you'll also need the pkg-config package from the same source (package name?).
A C++ compiler (e.g. GNU g++, Intel's icc)
